results.title: A Day in the Life of a Dairy Farm
results.brief_description: From sunrise to sunset, seven days a week, 365 days a year, a dairy farmer knows no rest. Spend a day with Les and Louise Calder on their dairy farm and observe a typical day’s activities. From artificial insemination to feeding and twice daily milking, come rain, hail or shine, these farmers work from dusk till dawn, everyday.
results.title_for_label: A Day in the Life of a Dairy Farm
results.description: From sunrise to sunset, seven days a week, 365 days a year, a dairy farmer knows no rest. results.title: The Loom never stops : a conversation with Thomas Ladgrove
results.creator_credit: Thomas Ladgrove and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: When Thomas Ladgrove started work at Brintons carpet factory in 1967, he was a ward of the state. He eventually started working with the loom and became the youngest weaver in Australia and England at age 18. He describes his work on the loom as well as staff morale when it became clear that Brintons was suffering, the subsequent rumours and worry and then the closure when the announcement to cease operations was made.
results.title_for_label: The Loom never stops : a conversation with Thomas Ladgrove
results.description: When Thomas Ladgrove started work at Brintons carpet factory in 1967, he was a ward of the state. results.title: Singing Stone
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
A hand clutches an oval stone which is drawn back and forth in tight circular motions, grinding pigment. Produced with a black and white half inch reel-to-reel portapak video recorder (manufactured c1975). ‘Singing Stone’ demonstrates Callas’ early experimentation with colouriser painting techniques. The effect is one of visual distortion in which pictorial surface and depth oscillate, creating a sense of dislocation and hallucination.
Notes by Rachel Kent, reprinted courtesy of the author and d/Lux Media Arts.

results.title: Blue Tongue
results.creator_credit: Timothy Jolley, Justin Kurzel and VCA Film and Television School, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description:
On the fringes of a housing estate a girl seduces a boy with a secret she will only reveal in exchange for his love. When the boy fails to honour the pact, what he holds close is threatened by the girl’s desire for revenge. Cast: Arlan Fahey Leigh and Siana Smit.
In 2005 ‘Blue Tongue’ was the first Australian short film to be selected for screening at the International Critics Week at the Cannes International Film Festival.

results.title: A Little something about us
results.creator_credit: School of Creative Arts, University of Melbourne and Sze Ching Lee
results.brief_description: Interviews with several young women from diverse Asian backgrounds who, through pixellated images, share their aspirations, interests, and love-hate relationships with Mellbourne, the city that has adopted them.

results.title: Nigel & Frank meet their matchbox
results.creator_credit: Sam Howie and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A light-hearted animated story of friendship and just how far two old mates will let greed and envy come between them when they discover a magic matchbox. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
